meanings.definition: In a fascicular manner; in bundles or clusters.
meanings.sent1: The flowers grew fascicularly in small groups, creating a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent2: The branches of the tree grew fascicularly, forming neat clusters of leaves.
meanings.sent3: The ants marched fascicularly, carrying tiny crumbs in their organized groups.
meanings.sent4: The students lined up fascicularly, like books neatly stacked on a shelf.
meanings.sent5: The stars twinkled fascicularly in the night sky, as if arranged in celestial bundles.

meanings.sent1: The fascicularly arranged cables made the room look tidy and organized.
meanings.sent2: The fascicularly stacked books on the shelf caught the librarian's eye.
meanings.sent3: The fascicularly placed chairs in the waiting room gave it a cozy feel.
meanings.sent4: The fascicularly aligned soldiers stood in perfect formation on the parade ground.
meanings.sent5: The fascicularly bundled flowers in the garden added a touch of elegance to the landscape.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or resembling a fascicle.
meanings.sent1: The fascicularly shaped crystals sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The fascicularly patterned fabric reminded her of a woven basket.
meanings.sent3: The fascicularly designed building had a unique and appealing look.
meanings.sent4: Her fascicularly styled hair drew many compliments at the party.
meanings.sent5: The fascicularly decorated cake looked too beautiful to eat at the celebration.
